text: Stephen Hopkins (March 7, 1707 â€“ July 13, 1785) was a Founding Father of the United States. He served as governor of the Colony of Rhode Island and Providence Plantations, chief justice of the Rhode Island Supreme Court, and was a signer of both the Continental Association and Declaration of Independence. Hopkins was from a prominent Rhode Island family. His grandfather, William Hopkins, was an influential colonial politician, while his great-grandfather Thomas Hopkins was among the original settlers of Providence Plantations. Thomas sailed from England in 1635 alongside his cousin, Benedict Arnold, who later became the first governor of the Rhode Island colony under the Royal Charter of 1663. == References == Category:1707 births Category:1785 deaths Category:Abolitionists from Rhode Island Category:American people of English descent Category:American politicians with disabilities Category:Chancellors of Brown University Category:Chief justices of the Rhode Island Supreme Court Category:Colonial governors of Rhode Island Category:Continental Congressmen from Rhode Island Category:Foundrymen Category:Governors of Rhode Island Category:Members of the Rhode Island General Assembly Category:Patriots in the American Revolution Category:Politicians from Providence, Rhode Island Category:People from Scituate, Rhode Island Category:People of Rhode Island in the American Revolution Category:Political leaders of the American Revolution Category:People from colonial Rhode Island Category:Signers of the United States Declaration of Independence Category:University and college founders Category:Burials at North Burying Ground (Providence) Category:American slave owners Category:Signers of the Continental Association Category:Founding Fathers of the United States Category:American lawyers with disabilities Category:Speakers of the Rhode Island House of Deputies Category:Members of the American Philosophical Society
